intro: Silene erciyesdaghensis, commonly known as the Erciyesdagh catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are arranged in a raceme. Silene erciyesdaghensis is a relatively rare species, found primarily in the Erciyes Mountains region.
